intro: Cliffortia rogersii, commonly known as the rogers' dainty mallow, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, woolly leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. It is a low-growing shrub that thrives in full sun and is well adapted to arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires careful watering to avoid root rot.
